column2: We have ushered a Golden Age after our victory over the Poles

With the unpopularity of this war amongst the nobility and the general populace, King Wladislaus the IVth promised to not draft civilians into the war effort. This drawback is not permanent, as the King slid a clause that if this war were to last past June, he would have the ability to conscript men into the army.
Although we have succeeded in unifying our holdings, this has not been done under ideal circumstances and the prestige of the crown is greatly harmed due to Bohemia still being under the Premyslid.
Rome's architecture was very much influenced by Ancient Greece's architecture style, whilst also being beautiful it also served it's purpose.
Although we have settled down into civilization, we have not ceased to require Mongol men to serve in the army for their early adulthood.
Forgotten about, the Great Sigmanistani race has been resurgent. May Allah smite the infidels.
Minor resurgence of the Rus capital
With our increased grain production in North Africa, we have reinstated the Grain Dole, a long staple of Roman rule
Our rise to Great Power status has led us to be the most powerful country of the islamic world
The Sicilian Method is currently the only way of extracting sulphur from volcanic rock, this gives us greater control over the sulphur market in europe.
